utterance.speaker: JULIE
utterance.content: So, have you picked a place yet?

utterance.speaker: SARAH VASQUEZ
utterance.content: I’d love to do it at the botanical gardens, but Chris thinks it’s too expensive.

utterance.speaker: JULIE
utterance.content: It’s your wedding! It’s supposed to cost a fortune.

utterance.speaker: SARAH
utterance.content: I know! You only get married once!

utterance.speaker: JULIE
utterance.content: Oh my God! Help! Somebody help! Help!

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll call you later. ‘Bye.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Who was that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Personal business, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really? Who is it? Inquiring minds want to know.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, if you must know, his name is Roger.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Roger.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t make fun. Do you know what he has that few men have?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A Josh Groban CD? Ah… Hummel figurines.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Not even close. Roger has the most incredible ... resistance band.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A resistance band? What is – is that what I think it is?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: For strength training? He’s my physical therapist.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah… oh. I had no idea you were still going.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, for another few weeks. Til I get 100%.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, good morning.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do we got?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Victim’s name is Sarah Vasquez. She’s a 28 year old kindergarten teacher. She and a classmate were leaving this yoga studio when Sarah suddenly dropped.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A bullet wound straight to the heart.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. What’s weird is that no one heard a shot or saw a shooter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, maybe the weapon was silenced.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe it was a stray bullet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just read an article about how a mailman in Portland was killed when a bullet fired into the air 6 blocks away fell back to Earth.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: This bullet didn’t just drop from the sky and hit Sarah Vasquez. Angle’s wrong. It went through her from front to back, not from up to down.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can you tell us point of origin?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Not until I do a full exam.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was yoga a regular thing for Sarah?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Tuesdays and Thursdays at 7AM before school started.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: ‘kay, let’s look into enemies and anyone that knew she was here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS NUNEZ
utterance.content: We just got engaged last month. She was so excited about planning the wedding.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Chris, was there anyone that might have wanted to hurt Sarah?

utterance.speaker: CHRIS
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe an old boyfriend who was upset about the wedding?

utterance.speaker: CHRIS
utterance.content: She didn’t have anyone like that in her life. Everyone loves Sarah. Wait … she did mention something last night about a guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Someone she knew?

utterance.speaker: CHRIS
utterance.content: No, uh… she said she saw him a few days ago outside the school and Tuesday morning she said she thought she saw him when she got out of yoga.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did she tell you what he looked like?

utterance.speaker: CHRIS
utterance.content: I – I can’t remember.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Looks like Sarah’s yoga routine was common knowledge. She even posted about it on Facebook. Joked that she was going to fit into that dress if it killed her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, somebody was following her, so let’s talk to her friends and coworkers and see if they saw a strange man hanging around.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: On it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Lanie’s got something. You should get down here.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: The bullet that killed Sarah Vasquez is a .308, specifically a 168 Sierra Grain MatchKing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A rifle bullet.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s common ammunition favored by … long range shooters.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So she was shot from a distance?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Based on her wound and how deep it went into the doorframe, I’d say that the bullet was fired between two and three hundred yards away.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Two hundred yards? Do we have any idea where from, exactly?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’re canvassing, but near as we can figure, the shooter fired from one of these buildings, somewhere between the 10th and 15th floor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys, you don’t have to avoid the word on my account.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What word?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sniper.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Even I noticed.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: We weren’t avoiding anything –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It was her idea. She was …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look guys, I’m a big girl, so let’s just cut to the chase. How good is this guy?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, he’s as good as any of the shooters – snipers – in my unit. He took out a moving target from a quarter of a mile away.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did she feel it?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: No. She died instantly.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then I guess the question is why did the sniper target Sarah? Any leads on the guy that she said was following her?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No one in her circle remembers seeing the guy and she didn’t mention him to anyone but her fiancé.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe he didn’t have anything to do with it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, usually we find out killers by knowing our victims, finding a motive. But what if there isn’t one? What if she was shot at random? How do we find him then?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Victim is Henry Wyatt, 38 year old attorney.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Same shooter?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Looks that way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anyone hear anything?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nada. It’s like before. He went for the head this time. He’s getting more confident.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Another victim, same time of day? This could be the DC sniper all over again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie, is that the slug?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yeah. It’s all banged up from the concrete, but it looks like the same caliber. The angle of entry is more extreme, though.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He shot Wyatt from higher up.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: See something?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Beckett, you all right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m just … uh… I’m just trying to figure out why these two victims, and why shoot here?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, the victims might be random but the location isn’t. A pro recons his target beforehand. If you’re going to kill something from a long distance it’s not a point-and-shoot activity. You factor in all the conditions, like range to target, minute of arc, and … windage.

utterance.speaker: BECKET
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This flag? It’s a perfect wind gauge.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That can’t be a coincidence.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so if he hung that up there we might be able to get eyes on him. We should canvass the area for security cameras and then –

utterance.speaker: VICTORIA GATES
utterance.content: We have a gunman terrorizing this city. Two victims in 24 hours. We don’t know who he is or why he shot those folks. Detective Ryan, what do we know about the second victim?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Henry Wyatt was a litigation partner at a law firm two blocks from where he was shot. According to his secretary he liked to walk, which means there was a predictable routine, just like Sarah Vasquez.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Which doesn’t mean they were targeted. After all, most New Yorkers follow routines. Esposito, have we learned where they were shot from?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’ve got teams sweeping buildings near both crime scenes and so far we’ve come up empty.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: We need to find our shooter …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That was just a startle response. It could happen to anyone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, I’m not anyone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I’m just saying –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, just don’t!

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Detective Beckett, where are we on Henry Wyatt and Sarah Vasquez?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: On links between the victims?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re still checking, but they don’t live or work in the same area and it doesn’t seem like they have anyone in common. In fact, we haven’t really found any connections between the two of them yet.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well, keep looking. We know he has training, a specific skill set. Now, every branch in the military has snipers, so do law enforcement agencies.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You’re talking close to a thousand qualified shooters.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: The fact is, everyone in this city is a potential target.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Let’s get it done, people!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait, where’re you going?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I – I just have to go do something.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, Beckett. Canvass turned up a security camera across from where the flag was hung. Footage is on its way in right now.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Is she okay?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, you don’t understand. I need to be okay!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t have PTSD.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, then fine! I’ll deal with them. Right now, I need to figure out how to make this stop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Listen, people are dying out there. I don’t have time to get all weepy over a couple of scars.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, there’s got to be a pill out there or something, right? Something to take the edge off?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well then, what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You don’t think I can handle this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Then you know what? I’m fine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How worried should I be about Beckett? She’s never snapped at me like that before.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And meant it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hell, it was bad for me when I came back and I never took a bullet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, at least she doesn’t remember it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Or she doesn’t want to remember.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A thing like that? It’s just easier to keep in a box. This case might bust that box open.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what can we do?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Catch the shooter.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He’s right. It’s the best thing for everyone. Beckett included. In the meantime, just give her space and don’t take it personally.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey guys, check this out. This is two days ago at 4:30PM.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He planted the flag. He’s gotta be our shooter.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He knows where the camera is. That’s why he keeps his face covered.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Why choose this street? Why not pick a place without any security cameras.?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Because he’s straight up taunting us.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I’ll run this photo by victims, coworkers, and friends, see if anyone recognizes him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He is not going to make it easy for us to catch him, is he?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. He’s smart, and he’s patient. It’s part of a sniper’s DNA.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah? Don’t go in. I’ll be there in 10.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uniform just found where the sniper shot Henry Wyatt from.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yep. Here’s the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: 600 yards. World class shot. It’s all wrong.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The view of the kill is almost partially obstructed by that tree. A better shot would have been from the roof. Our boy would have known that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So why wouldn’t he talk the shot from up there?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s possible he was worried about being seen by someone in a taller building or a helicopter.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A little paper doll. Think maybe it was left by the sniper?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Or one of the workman’s kids.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So the sniper took the shot from this window.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, he would have wanted to be invisible from the street. He would have taken the shot from … … right here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He took his time. Spot that flag, adjusted for wind, acquired his target … bam!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The shell casing … it would have ejected to the right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey! Where have you been? I called you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I, uh – my phone’s off. What’s – what’s up?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Shell casing from the sniper’s Wyatt hideout had a print on it. We just matched it to a former special forces sniper named Marcus Ford.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just went through a bitter divorce, textbook trigger for that kind of violence.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ford runs a shooting range in Long Island. State police have a tactical team on the way to meet us there now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe, uh, it would be a good idea if we hung back here? We’ll study up on Ford, just prep for the interrogation.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s a good idea. We’ve got it covered.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Officers found a whole arsenal at your shooting range, Mr. Ford.

utterance.speaker: MARCUS FORD
utterance.content: Last time I checked, I still had the right to bear arms.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, you should know that ballistics is testing your rifles.

utterance.speaker: FORD
utterance.content: Have at it. I didn’t shoot anyone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well that’s not exactly true, is it? According to your military record, you have 92 confirmed kills.

utterance.speaker: FORD
utterance.content: So?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You looking to make it an even 100? What’s it like to look through the scope? To play God? How do you feel when you pull that trigger and you destroy someone’s life?

utterance.speaker: FORD
utterance.content: It’s none of your damn business is how it feels!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what I think? I think that you should be on the other side of that barrel.

utterance.speaker: FORD
utterance.content: Is that a threat? Are you threatening me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who are those people? Are they just paper targets to you? Do you even think about the pain you’ve caused? About the families that you leave behind?

utterance.speaker: FORD
utterance.content: Every life I ever took saved one of ours!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The hell it did! You know what I think? I think that you liked it. I think that you couldn’t wait to kill again.

utterance.speaker: FORD
utterance.content: You’re out of your mind, lady.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We found your print on a shell casing left by the sniper.

utterance.speaker: FORD
utterance.content: That’s impossible.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That is a lie!

utterance.speaker: FORD
utterance.content: I have nothing left to say. I know my rights.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: None of Ford’s weapons are a match.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So? That doesn’t mean he’s not the sniper. He could have hidden the rifle.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Ford’s not our man. His alibis for both shootings are solid.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You sure?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I think I know how to check an alibi, Detective.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, if he’s not our man, how the hell did his fingerprint get on that shell casing?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Could be a reload. It’s easy enough to load a new bullet into a shell casing like the one we found. All you need is the right equipment.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which means our sniper is a client at Ford’s shooting range.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Go back in there and get his help.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s not going to want to talk to us after the way you went after him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what are you trying to say? That I screwed up?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, um…

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I think what he’s saying is that you played bad cop. And now we’ll get more out of Ford if I go in and play good cop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, fine.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe Ford can get us what we need to nail this guy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mr. Ford, my apologies.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett. Coffee?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, no thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s decaf. Look –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I’m fine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right, but –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No really, I’m fine. What’s in the folder?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: CSU report on the paper doll. This was not made by a kid. This was cut out very precisely with an x-acto knife.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: From what? A magazine?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, the paper stock is too heavy. And given there’s nothing printed on the back, it’s probably from some high end coffee table book of some kind. My guess – a book of paintings. If you look closely, you can see brush strokes. I think the sniper left that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would he do that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That much I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Marcus Ford was no help. He couldn’t ID the guy in the video. We’re pulling his credit card receipts, but he said that he shooting range was mostly a cash business.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett. Where? Okay, we’re on our way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ryan found the building the sniper shot Sarah Vasquez from.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Super recognized the jacket from the photos. Said he’d been hanging around the building.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How do we know he was in this room?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Because we found another one of these.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This is it. He shot Sarah Vasquez from right here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is different from the first one. Must be from a different painting. They’ve got to mean something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, like what? What’s it possibly going to mean?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know. But he’s leaving them for a reason.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, he’s screwing with us. He’s just taunting us and trying to make us look like idiots.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. We’ll figure it out, okay?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Found something. Moleskin. Hardcore military snipers put it on the stocks of their weapons to absorb sweat so the rifles don’t slip.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: If there’s sweat we can get DNA.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. Go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This is where it all started. He pulled the trigger right in this room. One second Sarah Vasquez is alive and dreaming of the perfect wedding, and then she isn’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kate –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know he saw her face when he killed her? People always think that snipers are so removed from their targets. But he wasn’t. He was as close as we are right now, looking through that scope.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’re gonna catch this guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Like we caught the guy that shot me.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA ROGERS
utterance.content: Oh darling, I hope you haven’t been up all night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I couldn’t sleep. Two days, two people dead. Someone out there is waking up, not knowing they’re going to be murder number three.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: I think I just decided to skip school today.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, I think you’re both under house arrest ‘til we catch this guy.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I can’t even imagine how this sniper is affecting Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She says she’s fine, but …

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: So what are you going to do?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The only thing I can do. Try to figure out why he’s leaving these damn dolls behind. If I could just figure out what painting they’re from…

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Let me see.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Chiaroscuro.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You recognize that?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It’s a style of painting that was invented during the Renaissance, exemplified by strong contrasts between light and dark. We learned about it in art history. Try looking up Caravaggio. Or Peterzano.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can I just say, this school of yours is worth every penny I paid. Hey, this might be it. Peterzano, The Persecution of Kings.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Beckett. DNA on the moleskin was a bust.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Ryan? You got results?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: There were no matches in the CODIS database. The best the lab was able to do was DNA phenotyping. They say they think our sniper is a male with light hair and brown eyes, but that still leaves us with over 200 suspects on our list.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I wouldn’t cut down the list yet. Given what we went through with the shell casing, there’s a chance that the moleskin’s not even his.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know what the paper dolls mean!

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Mr. Castle, now is not the time for your theatrics.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Captain, just listen. The paper dolls are predictive. The dolls are cut out of paintings that literally tell us the location of the next target. The one that we found at the first shooting? It comes from a painting called The Persecution of Kings.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Henry Wyatt was killed on King Street.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Exactly. The one that we found in the hideout of the second shooting, that’s from a painting called The Fall from Grace.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s a Grace Avenue in the Bronx.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Grace Church is on … 10th Street and 4th Avenue.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And there’s about a dozen other possibilities. If we can narrow it down we might be able to stop him before …

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett! Grace.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How many people are dead?

utterance.speaker: EMT
utterance.content: None.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank God.

utterance.speaker: EMT
utterance.content: Yeah. A sniper opened fire through a window of a conference room on the 15th floor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is anyone else injured?

utterance.speaker: EMT
utterance.content: No. Just her. Her name is Emily Reese, and he only shot at her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Emily, my name is Detective Kate Beckett. I need you to tell me what happened.

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: Why me? What did I do? Why is somebody trying to kill me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Emily, have you seen anyone watching you lately?

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: What? I – I don’t know, I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: EMT
utterance.content: We got to get her to the hospital.

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: No! Don’t let them take me outside! He’s still out there!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, you’re going to be okay, Emily.

utterance.speaker: EMILY
utterance.content: Please don’t do this! He’s still out there. He’s going to kill me!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just go! Get her out of here. Now! Go!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett! Kate!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s spinning out of control. She’s losing her ability to cope.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She should not be on this case.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, she’s not just going to walk away.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know. She’s going to drive herself into the ground. And you’re the only one that has any idea as to what she’s going through. So what helped you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Espo, what are we doing back here?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I want to show you something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What is that?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s a rifle. That shot you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You are way out of line.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Just look at it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No… what the hell are you doing?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’ve been where you are. I know what you’re going through.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Javi, I’m fine.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You’re not fine. You’re just trying to act like you are. This is just a tool. It’s a hunk of steel. It has no magical powers and the person that fired it is not some all-powerful god. He’s just a guy, with a gun. Just like the guy we’re hunting now. And like every other bad guy, he’s damaged goods.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So am I.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s right. And that’s okay. You think it’s a weakness? Make it a strength. It’s a part of you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So use it.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Any idea why the sniper targeted Emily Reese?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not yet. She was a VP at a telecom company, single, just bought an apartment on West 96th. No known connections to the other vics, but we do know he was following her.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Castle! What do you have?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re looking at video taken from Emily’s lobby yesterday at 1:40. That’s 4 hours after he shot Wyatt. There’s Emily getting into the elevator.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: There he is. That’s our guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Unfortunately we still can’t see his face.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What is he waiting for?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He’s watching to see what floor she’d get off on. He knew exactly where she was going to be. It’s a miracle Emily’s not dead.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s no miracle. It’s poor planning. Turns out, our sniper used the wrong ammo. The 168 Grain loses stability when it goes through glass. The 165 is designed for that kind of shot. He didn’t know that, which means he has less experience then we thought.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Okay, we need to go back to the suspect list, cross off all law enforcement shooters and any combat vets with urban experience.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is it just me, or is his coffee cup identical to Emily’s?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Same logo … it’s from the same shop.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Zoom in on that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Café … Primo. Must have followed her from there. If he’s a customer, maybe someone can ID him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s only one Café Primo. It’s on 47th Street … two blocks from the Grace Point Tower where Emily worked.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Okay, we need to find out if any of the other victims have a connection to that shop.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Uh, where’s Beckett?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She’s running down a lead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would you shoot from here when the roof gave you a cleaner shot?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That coffee shop may be the key. Sarah Vasquesz lived 6 blocks from the Grace Point Tower. She had a receipt in her wallet from Café Primo dated 3 days ago.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What about Henry Wyatt?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wyatt’s therapist has an office right across the street from the coffee shop. They had a session two days before he was killed.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: That shop has got to be ground zero where he selected his victims. Get down there and get me an ID. The clock’s ticking on his next victim.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT
utterance.content: Yeah, they all get coffee here on a pretty regular basis. Are you saying he shoots people from my shop?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It could be just a coincidence. Have any of them been in here together?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe talking to each other? Or anyone else, for that matter.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT
utterance.content: Not that I remember.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What about this guy? Is he a customer?

utterance.speaker: ROBERT
utterance.content: Is that the sniper?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Have you seen him? Does he look familiar?

utterance.speaker: ROBERT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT
utterance.content: Sorry. I - maybe if I could get a better look at his face –

utterance.speaker: EMPLOYEE
utterance.content: Robert, phone call.

utterance.speaker: ROBERT
utterance.content: Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: GUY ON PHONE
utterance.content: Yo dude, I totally closed the deal. Eight figures and a piece of merchandising. No, it was epic, bro!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I hate to think any of these people are dead just because they pick the wrong place to buy a coffee.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s not the coffee shop. I know how the victims are connected.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sarah Vasquez just got engaged. Henry Wyatt just made partner at his firm.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And Emily Reese just bought a giant apartment on the Upper West Side.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They all had recent successes. According to our profile, this sniper is a paranoid loner. He feels alienated, victimized, by the world. He comes in here for a cup of coffee and he hears about how well everyone’s doing, how their dreams are coming true while his are not. It makes him feel invisible. It makes him feel angry. So he picks one of them out and he makes them pay.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Even if you’re right, it doesn’t get us any closer to catching this guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It might if we ask the right question.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He didn’t shoot from the roof because he couldn’t climb the ladder. If you look at the video there’s a slight hitch in his step. I think he has a physical disability.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um, Robert. A guy with a limp, or a leg injury?

utterance.speaker: ROBERT
utterance.content: There is a homeless guy who’s been hanging around the last few weeks. I think he’s got a prosthetic leg.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re going to need a description.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Adding disability and partial and/or full amputation to the list cuts it down from 207 … to 3. Eric Howard, Lee Travis –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s him! Lee Travis.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s 38 years old. He did a year in the Marines before losing his right leg in a hit-and-run motorcycle accident.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: They never caught the driver of the car and Lee was given honorable discharge.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And according to his counselor, Lee went into a deep depression and tried to turn his anger against the world.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He took a string of low paying jobs, including a stint as a security guard for the Metropolitan Museum of Art, where his former boss said he spent a lot of time in the Old Masters section, home of Caravaggio and Peterzano.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: All right, I’m releasing Lee’s photo and bio to the media. Within the hour every person in New York will know who he is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, sir, are you sure that’s a good idea? If he knows that we’re closing in that might trigger another shooting.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: We need to risk it. We put his face out there it could give us a lead on his whereabouts. What do we know about his family?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He has a sister in Queens. Esposito’s tracking her down right now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re not surprised.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: When was the last time you saw him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know where he’s living?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you think you could write down the license plate number?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me. Beckett. Where? We’re on our way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, we’ve got to go. Uniforms just found the third hide, where Emily Reese was shot from.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How is he finding these places?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Same way he chooses his victims. He listens. He’s homeless, so nobody notices him. Once he finds the building he’ll be shooting it he recons it for the best vantage point. Castle, we need to find that paper doll, see where he’s going to strike next.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Found it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Does it ID the next victim?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not victim. Victims.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Patrol unit found Lee’s car. These were in the trunk.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Any sign of the guy?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: All right, listen up. I want all units on tactical alert. Lee Travis is out there, right now, with his weapon, intending to kill multiple victims. And given that the first three were shot in the morning, we don’t have a lot of time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I got it.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: You know where he cut the chain of dolls from?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I convinced them to let me into the museum early. I compared the dolls to all the paintings in their collection. It’s called Lions in the Meadow.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: The only meadow I know of in New York is in – is in Central Park.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We should assume that Travis is already in position. If we start clearing the park he might start firing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoever these dozen victims are, he's targeting them for the same reason he went after the others, so we can assume they’re all part of the same group.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Beckett, take everyone we can spare and head for the park. I want you on place and ready to move when we figure this out. Ryan, get on the phone to the parks department. Find out what they have scheduled there this morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle! You coming?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m more useful here helping Ryan figure out who the targets are. You got this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All that tree cover is going to make it hard for him to target any large area of the park.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Also, the buildings on the east and west sides of the park are high end apartments, with doormen.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which means he’d have to shoot from the south end of the park.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Just got off the phone with the parks department. There’s over a dozen events planned in Central Park today.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Anything on the south end?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh … nature sanctuary tour and uh … celebration for Western High School. Their track team just won the state championship. They should be on their way into the park right now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait … Western High School. It’s 3 blocks away from the coffee shop. Their team is called the Lions.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: He must have heard one of the parents or students boasting about winning that meet. How’d they get into the park?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Driven in by bus.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I’ll call ESU. Ryan, you need to stop that bus.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They said the school has a bus unloading at the Grand Army Plaza entrance at the park. ESU told Gates that these two buildings had the best vantage point for the sniper.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How long ‘til ESU counter snipers get here?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: 10 minutes. So search all of the floors above the 20th. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: C’mon, c’mon. Answer your phone, damn it!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ve got an open door, suite 2124. I’m going in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Police, stop!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Put the gun down, Lee.

utterance.speaker: LEE
utterance.content: I have a job to do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why don’t you just call it what it is, okay? You shoot people in cold blood.

utterance.speaker: LEE
utterance.content: Those people deserve what they’re getting. God blessed them. He gave to them and took from me. My leg, my life … how is that fair, huh? How is that right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Those people that you blame? They’re no different from you.

utterance.speaker: LEE
utterance.content: You’re just saying that because you’re one of them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You think my life is a picnic? I know what it feels like to be in those crosshairs. To feel the bullet burn through my chest. I know what it feels like to have my life leave my body. And I think you do too. That’s why you keep leaving those paper dolls behind, because you’re looking for somebody to help you find another way.

utterance.speaker: LEE
utterance.content: There is no other way. Not anymore.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, no! There’s always another way. I want to help you. I know that you’re in pain and we can find a better voice for your pain. Please, just put that gun down.

utterance.speaker: LEE
utterance.content: Just turn around.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: LEE
utterance.content: Don’t look at me, just turn around.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: LEE
utterance.content: Turn around!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No! If you’re going to shoot me, you look at me in the eyes, okay? And you look hard, because I’m not your enemy. I can’t be. You and I have too much in common.

utterance.speaker: LEE
utterance.content: No we don’t. I have a job to do.

utterance.speaker: LEE
utterance.content: I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just waiting for my partner. Maybe you’ve seen her. Pretty girl, thinks she can leap tall buildings in a single bound, carries the weight of the world on her shoulders, yet still manages to laugh at some of my jokes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She sounds like a handful.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tell me about it. Anyway, if you do see her, tell her she owes me about … a hundred coffees.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: For what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: For not pushing and giving me the space to get through this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Always.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I thought that taking him down would resolve things, but it’s still there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No… I felt it before the shooting. I think it’s always been there, deep inside since that night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm. I’ve let it define me, drive me. It’s made me who I am, but now …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I want to be more … than who I am. But I don’t know if I know how to do that without letting my mom down.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How am I supposed to let go?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I think I am.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
